channel.title: Comments on: When the holy man was asked, “How should we treat others?” His reply was, “There are no others.”

item.title: By: Nanette D. Massey
item.dc:creator: Nanette D. Massey
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://samj921.github.io/nanettedmassey/when-the-holy-man-was-asked-how-should-we-treat-others-his-reply-was-there-are-no-others/#comment-6">H. Hartel</a>.
Hi. Thank you for coming! Did you stay 'til the end? How did you hear about the workshop? And please give me some details about your experience. --Nanette
item.content:encoded:
In reply to H. Hartel.

Hi. Thank you for coming! Did you stay ’til the end? How did you hear about the workshop? And please give me some details about your experience. –Nanette

item.title: By: H. Hartel
item.dc:creator: H. Hartel
item.description: To my knowledge, the holy man who said this was Ramana Maharshi. I have several of his devotees in my family and frequent the Arunachala Ashrama in NYC. I attended your workshop in Williamsville yesterday. Thank you for doing this important work.
item.content:encoded: To my knowledge, the holy man who said this was Ramana Maharshi. I have several of his devotees in my family and frequent the Arunachala Ashrama in NYC. I attended your workshop in Williamsville yesterday. Thank you for doing this important work.

item.title: By: M. Ricardo Hayes
item.dc:creator: M. Ricardo Hayes
item.description: Seems like a good beginning of great groundwork.
item.content:encoded: Seems like a good beginning of great groundwork.
